title: Bug 108822: Inaccurate disk sorting logic when there is a border value for row count
OB: When sorting data on disk with 40000 rows, and setting the program to process data less than 40000 rows, the observed behavior is as follows: 1. The file is saved as a temporary file. 2. The file is called into memory. 3. Sorting is performed on the data. 4. The sorted file is saved as a temporary file.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Sort data on disk with 40000 rows. 2. Set the program to process data less than 40000 rows. Observe the steps mentioned above and confirm the accuracy of the disk sorting logic.
